author: R Krishnamoorthy
text:
Pongal celebrations wrapped ambience of education institutions with rural aura in the district over the last few days.

The festival integral to lives of farmers was celebrated in traditional trappings on the premises replete with cooking of Pongal in mud pots, and conduct of events such showcasing rural charm.

Breaking of bunches of sugarcanes, 'Uri Adithal, rope-pulling, planting of saplings, kolam competition, and pot decoration marked Pongal celebrations in the Bannari Amman Institute of Technology, Sathyamangalam. At a function, speakers highlighted the importance of 'Bhogi', Pongal and 'Mattu' Pongal, and urged youngsters to celebrate the event with parents.

The M.P. Nachimuthu M. Jaganathan Engineering College christened the celebration as 'Sangamam 2016', and conducted events befitting the occasion at a temple on the institution premises.

At the EBET Group of Institutions, Kangeyam, students and staff members took part in the festivities along with the management representatives.

Shouts of 'Pongalo Pongal' rent the air when students of Navarasam College for Women, Arachalur, cooked the sweet dish using pots adorned with turmeric leaves.

Students gathered in large numbers to celebrate 'Samathuva Pongal' in Aishwarya Polytechnic College, Sri Vinayaga College of Education and Aishwarya College of Engineering and Technology.
title: Campuses celebrate Pongal
